channel.title: 562 afk message?
channel.description: id love some help with adding an afk message thanks

item.title: 562 afk message?
item.dc:creator: @xneonx xneonx
item.description:
@xneonx wrote:

If you weren’t wanting to add a command and just a message then try doing something like this. Go to src\com\rs2hd\packethandler\IdlePacketHandler.java Now if you don’t have a private int msg, then add one, then add a public void handlePacket(Player player, IoSession session, Packet packet) { try { msg = Misc.random(3); if(msg == 0) { player.sm("Wake up bitch!"); Then you can add more if you want just make sure to add 1 after the msg == Like msg == 1, msg == 2 and so on. Hope this helps

Read full topic

item.title: 562 afk message?
item.dc:creator: @xhavefunx xhavefunx
item.description:
@xhavefunx wrote:

Go to Src -> Com -> Rs2hd -> Packethandler -> and open Commandspackethandler.java

Try to find here your other commands.

~ Tip: use CTRL + F and enter a command you know, like ::Home or something. ~

After you have find this, choose one command to enter the afk command under it.
So, if you have:

}
if(cmd[0].equals("::skele")) {
player.resetAttack();
player.getTele().ancientTelePlayer(player,1895 ,5355 , 2, 2);
}

Then u enter UNDER the } this command:

if(cmd[0].equals("::afk")) {
player.animate(4117);
player.getUpdateFlags().setForceTextUpdateRequired(true);
player.forceChat("i'm afk guys!");
}

Make sure u don’t have a } to much.
It’s opening a command with ( { ) and closing with ( } )
You don’t need 2 at one place.

Enter under the ::afk command this command:

if(cmd[0].equals("::back")) {  
player.animate(6297);
player.getUpdateFlags().setForceTextUpdateRequired(true);
player.forceChat("Hey guys, i'm back!");
}

So, you will have something like this:

If this is not exactly what you tought, then be more specified next time

Read full topic
